title: Episode 31 - "Cookout"
guest_stars: Emeril Lagasse, Nathalie Dupree, Martin Yan

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (slurps soda) Beef-a-roni.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (slurps coffee) Beef-a-ghetti.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fellas, fellas! (laughing) Come on, now! They're both so good!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Good evening and bon appetit! It's Space Ghost Coast to Coast! Tonight, a no-holds-barred cook-off between television chefs Emeril Lagasse, Nathalie Dupree and Martin Yan. Plus, Zorak and the Original Way Outs. And now, prepare to clean your palate with a fresh blast of minty wintergreen! Spaaaaace Ghooooost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Buon giorno, hungry citizens! Welcome to our show du jour! Tonight we've got three of TV land's favorite chefs in the kitchen with Space Ghost for a little cooking competition. Here to help us judge the contest, our very own Council of Doom. Lokar.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, ho, ho, hi.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Metallus.

transcript.speaker: Metallus
transcript.dialogue: (drones)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Black Widow.

transcript.speaker: Black Widow
transcript.dialogue: Whooooooooo!!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tansut.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Just me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And Brak.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I got... I got pink eye.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sup sup sup) Ready to eat, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, listen, I want all the bones when we're done.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not a problem.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Make sure he wipes 'em off.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And, um, uh, get 'em in a bag.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: A bone bag. Gimme a bone bag.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Enough! You can have all the bones when we're done!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Somebody! I wanna eat!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Grab some crackers, that's what the machine's for.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti! Oh, shut up the both of you!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thanks, Brak.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: No problem.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Hey hey!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah, here's our first chef contestant. Greetings, citizen! How are you today?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I'm doin' unbelievable.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I believe you! Identify yourself to the universe!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I am Emeril Lagasse, uh, chef and restaurateur of New Orleans.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you getting enough oxygen, Chief Emeril?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I'm uh, I'm getting plenty right now, it's feeling real good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Chef, chef, chef, chef, chef, chef. (laughs) Remember him, he was the, the Stooge nobody liked.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (long cough)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Emeril) Have you ever been in outer space before?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Absolutely not! I'm kind of excited about this.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, you should be. So, how did you become a (begin echo effect) Chef Of The Future? (end echo effect)

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I started cooking and liked it, and did more of it and liked it, and one day I got up and then I really loved it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No way! It can't be that easy!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: You better believe it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I don't believe it.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: 'kay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Say, Emeril, people are always saying things taste like chicken. You know, frogs, woolly spider monkeys, Herculoids. Is that true?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Well, you know, um, people drive me crazy when they say like that, it's like, anything that's mysterious, they say, "Well, it tastes like chicken." It doesn't taste like chicken, it, it tastes like frog, or, it, it tastes like rabbit, that's what it is, it's not chicken. Chicken's chicken.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh. I bet Zorak would taste like chicken. Have you ever cooked a giant evil praying mantis?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Oh, listen, we, we do food from love, food of love. So, uh, evil is not allowed in the kitchen.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever cooked a human? Out of love.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Um, I haven't tried any humans yet.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Say, do you know Chef Boy-ar-dee?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Uh, we've never met! We never met. I'd like to meet him someday, though.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni or Beef-a-ghetti?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-ghetti!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Hey, eat a chicken basket, though.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat) What do you like to cook the most, Emeril?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Well, I, I just like cooking food.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I just like eating food. What do you like to eat the most?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I love beef.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: ... a-ghetti.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I love pork too. I think actually pork rules. Actually, in my new book, I think the slogan is, "Pork fat rules."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Pork fat rules"?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, the flavor is, you just can't beat it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'm with ya.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: What, what kind of food do you like?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Emeril, I like food. You know, food food fit in the stomach food.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: You like dense food?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Indeed I do! The denser the better.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Muffins?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thick, hearty and dense. That's for me!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Oooh, we'll have to cook something dense for you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh! Would you?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Some dense cuisine.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmmm...

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Gooey and dense.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dense, right?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I must warn you, I can eat a manly pile!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: That's okay, we got plenty of food!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then feed me, Emeril. Make me a manly pile!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I'm lookin' forward to cookin' for you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And I'm looking forward to... eating... from you.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost? (his image begins to fade from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whatever.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Hello? (his image dissolves into static)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Anyway, while Emeril goes to the kitchen--

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Hey! I, I wa-- uh... I, I want the bones when we're done.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okey dokey, not a problem.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm thinking about making a soup. (Emeril's image fades back in) Don't, don't forget about the bones!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's just what I need for my... bone soup.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: ... I told you it was just a matter of time before I had the opportunity to cook for you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh, Emeril, what are you going to cook with today? Besides your hands, I mean.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Duck. But not only is it, like, just duck, Space Ghost, it's duck confit, which means it's been like smothered in fat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmmm, I'm in carbohydrate heaven! And, what are you gonna make with this confit?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Duck tacos with kicked-up salsa, and a lot of bam --

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Bam.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: -- just for you. This is the kicked-up salsa right here. (Space Ghost scoots closer) Black beans, spicy corn, lots of peppers to just put your mouth on fire, and some greens.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greens? Eeaaah! I say thee, nay! Oh well, I can scrape 'em off anyway... Uh, what are you putting on the tortillas?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: This is the essence of Emeril right there. And just, these are little baby bams, see? (high voice) Bam bam bam...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bam.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Bam!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Little baby bams. Now, I gotta like make this incredible... mixture, this duck mixture.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did you kill that duck yourself?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Uh, we kinda don't ask those questions, Space Ghost. On, on Earth here, you know, we got to be careful about those things.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) Ooooh, yeah, the duck people.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: In order to try to get you healthy, Space Ghost, at least for five seconds, some greens.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ewww, no. Yuk.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: And this is a little cilantro dressing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Is that like ranch?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: This is, uh, it's, it's a little bit different than ranch. But, uh, we can pretend it's ranch dressing if you want, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, let's pretend it's ranch dressing!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Now watch this, we're gonna, we're gonna start by putting this dish together for you. Kinda funky shapes. And, uh, we're gonna do some kicked-up salsa...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Kick it! Kick it in the head!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Then we're gonna take some of these greens--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: On the side! Oh, uh, go ahead, put 'em in.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Then we're gonna do another little tortilla like that. Then... your favorite, without the bones, of course, duck meat.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Of course.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Are you with me so far, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All the way!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Then we're gonna put another tortilla, and then we're gonna take the kicked-up salsa again...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Kick it where it hurts!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Then we'll, like, put another layer like this.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (watching from control room) Ohhhhh! It's beautiful!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Then we'll kinda take a little bit more of that duck meat, you see?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's so... hefty!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: It's gettin' tall.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Does it ever end? (harp music in background)

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I don't know how hungry you are, that's why I'm gonna keep building it until you, like, surrender.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whoa. I surrender!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: We gotta have to give it a little BAM! --

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aims his power bands)

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: -- just like that, don't get frightened.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry, dynamic reflexes.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: And that's my dish for you, Space Ghost. It's the, uh, "Kicked-Up Duck Tacos".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, you would smother that in cheese sauce, right?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: That's entirely up to you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gravy?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: I wouldn't recommend gravy on this, on this particular dish for you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: 'Nilla puddin'?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: No pudding.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No ketchup?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: No ketchup.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tartar sauce.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: You gotta get out of that habit, Space Ghost. I'm trying to kick you up a notch.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Consider me kicked!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, the bones.

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, we'll put the bones, when we're done, in the bag for you, too. Just be patient.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Emeril, who do you think will win here tonight?

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Martin has big cleavers, Space Ghost. I just have essence.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I see! Well, let's see your entry.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmmmm! Ahhhhhh!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmmmm! Ahhhhhh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmmmm! Ahhhhhh!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (still watching from control room) Ahhhhhh! I'm in love!

transcript.speaker: Emeril Lagasse
transcript.dialogue: It's time to dine!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We'll be right back!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (not realizing he is on camera) [Belllllllllllllcccccccccchhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!] Oh man... I undid my belt three notches, and I still feel like ten pounds of potatoes in a three pound sack.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, wide load, we're back.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, hello there! Welcome, citizen chef! Please identify yourself to the cosmos!

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: I'm Nathalie Dupree. I'm the cook.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're the cook?

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: Well, yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'll be the judge of that.

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Make me a chicken chimichanga!

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Why?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, because this is a cooking competition. And, because I want a chicken chimi!

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: Oh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And because this is my show, and because I said so.

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: I see...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then start cooking!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I have a question.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak has a question.

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: Yeah? What does he want to know?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Make it quick.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Do you have any bones?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He wants your bones.

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm... that's really distressing.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I need your bones... for my soup... you see, I'm gonna put the bones... in... the soup. And it's... the bones go... in the soup.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: That's not very loving.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Life's not very loving.

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what's the deal, you gonna cook for me, or what?

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: No. No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, you're not going to cook for me.

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Yeah" you will, or "yeah" you won't?

transcript.speaker: Nathalie Dupree
transcript.dialogue: No. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Have it your way, then. Cook, or be cooked! (blasts her off the monitor) Well, you know what they say, if you can't stand the guest, blast her out of the kitchen!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Liar! Nobody says that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Gimme a chef that'll play ball!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws a lever, sending Martin to the studio monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, citizen chef! Identify yourself, please!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: I am Martin Yan, of the "Yan Can Cook" show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can Yan cook?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: I'll show you later.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's what I like to hear! So, citizen Yan...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: "Are you getting enough oxygen?"

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: "Are you getting enough oxygen?"

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Man, am I getting sick of that!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: I have plenty of oxygen, but if I want extra oxygen, I drink soy sauce, doing fermentation, so I got more oxygen, that's how I derive most of my additional oxygen.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Coo-coo-nutty! So, do you have any superpowers besides soy sauce drinking?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: I work out in the kitchen, and I'm powerful enough. But for additional power, (clangs meat cleaver) this is additional power.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aims power bands) What are you doing with that?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: (pause) If I don't get nervous, you shouldn't get nervous.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm... Good point. (stops aiming)

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: You know, I would like to put you in an oven, 375 degree, and roast it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry Martin! Yan Can't Cook Space Ghost! It's rude!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: I would put butter on you, and you'd taste better. You taste good, you'd taste even better.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Cook him! Cook him! Cook him now!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up, Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Make me!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: When you talk too much, I put an apple in your mouth, and you'll shut up.

transcript.speaker: Zorak & Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laugh hysterically)

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: ... but of course, you're such a nice guy, I would never do that to you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak & Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Boo! Boo! Boo!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Suck-up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whew! (laughs) I gotta tell you, Marty, for a minute there, I thought you were really gonna cook me! Put those away. You're pretty crazy, you know that? (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: I'm crazy? That's what my mother told me! I believe it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: As well you should, my boy, as well you should. So, who do you think is going to win our little cooking contest, hmm?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: You know, Emeril is a good friend of mine, and he's a master chef, and I'm quite sure he'll win.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ten bucks on Emeril! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: He also is better looking than me, so I better let him win.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: A hundred bucks on Urkel! Er, Emeril!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, then, are you ready to cook, and lose?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: Let's cook, and maybe feed this ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Alrighty. We'll be back with more delicious food after these important messages. (giant eyeball appears on monitor) Aaaaa!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: (to someone offscreen) I'm sorry, it's this cheap watch. (takes his watch off)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, Martin's back! And, so's my appetite! What are ya making there, Martin?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: I'm gonna show you how to do a chicken, okay?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmmm, chicken tastes like chicken!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: First, you see saw your knife, and you roll your bell pepper look like that. (cores & cuts the bell pepper in one motion) Wow, look at that, the whole thing, done! Ah, I am impressed! And then you cut it up (chops rapidly with cleaver) like that. (more chopping) I'm very impatient, that's how come I go so fast.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wwwwwhy don't you watch what you're cutting?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: When I look, I get nervous, that's the reason why.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I get it. I'm like that with girls.

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: You know, this chicken (wiggles the legs around) is somewhat nervous, 'cause it's never, never get such close encounter with a Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Maybe it's nervous because it's naked.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ewwwwwwwwww, yeh!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: So when the chicken is nervous, you know what? You gotta relax your chicken.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Relax the chicken?!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Relax the chicken?!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Relax the chicken?!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: If the chicken is not relaxed, like it's nervous, you can't cut through this, see? So, how do you relax a chicken? You hold it with free hand. Now, Moltar, pay attention. And Zorak, pay --

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever in control room, monitor changes to a "CHiPs" episode, where a boat trailer crashes into a parked car) Whoa, speedboat? Look at it backing up.

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: You hold onto it like that, you go up and down, up and down, never horizontal movement...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, get that camera off me!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: Up and down, up and down, up and down, up and down. After five up and down you go circular motion, like that, ah, the chicken is getting nervous. No more nervous, relaxing. You do about five complete cycles, this is great exercise. One two three four five, one two three four five... (continues exercising the chicken)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Amazing!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: This is my daily exercise in the kitchen.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Man, who needs PBS with educational programming like this?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: Then, when it's nice and ready, look at that, the chicken's very relaxed. The chicken is so relaxed --

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The chicken isn't relaxed; the chicken's dead!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is not, it was just moving, I saw it!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: This chicken's alive!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Okay, the chicken's alive. So, Yan can cook. And Yan can go insane. Got it. (whistles)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak! No insulting the guests!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, but blasting them is peachy?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Darn tootin', nephew breath.

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: (slaps his cleaver) Space Ghost, Moltar and Zorak, pay attention, heh! Three (slap!), two (slap!), one, one cut, another cut, turn around the side, one cut along the back, hold like this, and you disjoint this, and the whole chicken breast comes out, and the thigh, and the leg, comes out, the tenderon, on this side, comes out, turn it to the other side, and then, disjoint this, the whole chicken breast comes out, the thigh, and the leg, comes out, the last piece of the tenderon, comes out... Space Ghost, are you impressed?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You killed the chicken.

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: No I didn't. I just dissected, the word "kill" is not appropriate. I just cut it up because I know that you are hungry.

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: Then, I put the chicken, which you can marinade the chicken, I put it right over here...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And then what?! You kill some more, o grim reaper!?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: A very little oil, and you stir and you stir, look at this. When the chicken's almost ready, you put the rest of the stuff in, like this. Mmmmm, you know what, it's gonna look very, very good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's barely a recipe!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmm! In such a short time, I have showed you how to do two wonderful, delicious, healthy, economical dish that you can serve over rice, or spaghetti...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Beef-a-roni, perhaps?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No, beef-a-ghetti!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Or maybe burritos?

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: Or, you can wrap this up with a burrito...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, a close-up of the grub! (camera shows close-up of the food) Say! That looks good enough to eat! Okay! Thanks for coming, citizen Yan! Goodnight, everybody!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, hey, hey! The bones!

transcript.speaker: Martin Yan
transcript.dialogue: Okay. Zorak, ah, have it!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, like I'm s'posed to catch that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Goodnight, everybody!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Wait, wai- wai- wa- hol- ho- ho- ho- ... You never told us who won.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's a tie. Goodnight, everybody!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Wait, wait, wha- wha- what about the Council of Doom?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Council of Doom? Where?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Over here, you git!

transcript.speaker: Black Widow
transcript.dialogue: (screams, and gets blasted by Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: She didn't do anything to you! And now, look at what you did!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry. Just went off.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: I don't think I like you anymore.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who invited you guys? Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: You invited us to judge your r-r-ridiculous culinary display.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I did?

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Yes you did.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (nervous laugh) Well, thank you for coming.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Déjà vu, you pusillanimous pile of pulchritude.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Hey! That's Latin for "beautiful". You, you, you just called him beautiful! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Oh.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I think he's pretty.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you kiss him, already? (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Well, occasionally these multisyllabic words confound even me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey Lokar, confound this! (aims power bands at Lokar)

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: Perhaps we can discuss this matt -- aaaahhh!! (gets blasted)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, Tansut, it looks like you've jumped out of the frying pan and into the --

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Wait, wait! Don't! No, no! Metallus! Do him first!

transcript.speaker: Metallus
transcript.dialogue: (drones)

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: M comes before T! M comes before T!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, Metallus, looks like you've jumped out of the frying pan and into the fire! (blasts him) Tansut!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: (subdued) Okay. Now I'm ready. Oh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts Tansut) Okay, Widow! Looks like you've jumped ou-- no, I've already got you. Well, Brak, looks like you --

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Wait! Wha- wo- we- wait, I mean, is this gonna hurt?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A wee mite.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, okay, well, just don't get me in the face.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts Brak)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (coughs and yells)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How was that?

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: That hurt!!! Owww!! (coughs) You're gonna hear from my lawyer!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: I'm hungry, I'm tired! I wanna eat!
